text: When I want to show affection, I notice how my partner receives love and choose to express it in ways they understand.
During moments when my partner shows love, I notice their way of expressing it and choose to receive it with appreciation.
When I feel love for someone, I recognize their love language and choose to express it in a way that truly lands.
I let confusion about love languages prevent me from expressing or receiving affection effectively.
When I notice my partner doesn't feel loved, I pause and consider their love language instead of assuming they understand mine.
I see when I'm expressing love in my own way instead of my partner's way, and I choose to adapt my expression.
When I feel disconnected, I notice whether we're speaking different love languages and choose to bridge the gap.
I let misunderstanding about how I express and receive affection create distance in my relationships.
When I notice my partner showing love in their way, I recognize it and choose to feel it even if it's different from mine.
I recognize when affection isn't landing, and I choose to learn and adapt to the other person's love language.
When I feel the urge to show love only in my preferred way, I notice it and choose to express it in theirs too.
I let not knowing how to express or receive affection effectively prevent me from feeling deeply connected.
When I notice my love language differs from my partner's, I recognize it and choose to learn and speak both languages.
I see when affection is being expressed but not received, and I choose to understand and adjust my approach.
When I feel love but struggle to express it, I notice the gap and choose to learn effective ways to communicate it.
I let confusion about love languages prevent me from understanding how I express and receive real affection.
When I notice my partner's way of showing love, I observe and learn their language instead of expecting them to use mine.
I recognize when I'm not feeling loved because of a language mismatch, and I choose to communicate my needs clearly.
When I feel the pull to only receive love in my preferred way, I notice it and choose to appreciate other expressions too.
I let not understanding my love language prevent me from expressing and receiving affection effectively.
